info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 3:34PM PST until December 27 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 14 inches possible, with locally higher amounts to 20 inches. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Klamath Basin and Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. This includes Highway 97, 140 and 31 as well as Klamath Falls, Chemult, Bly and surrounding communities. For the Winter Storm Watch, Highway 97 Modoc Point to Gilchrist. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull in showers is expected Saturday morning through the afternoon, where new snowfall will be light (less than 2.5 inches), but gusty winds of 20-25 mph will continue to cause drifting snow and reduced visibility. Snowfall will increase intensity again starting Saturday evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
